meanings.definition: To cause annoyance or worry to
meanings.sent1: The loud music bothers me when I'm trying to study.
meanings.sent2: The barking dog bothers the neighbors every night.
meanings.sent3: It bothers me that I forgot to bring my umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise bothers my concentration like a buzzing fly.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag bothers my skin and makes me itch.

meanings.definition: To take the trouble to do something
meanings.sent1: She bothers to bake cookies for the school fundraiser.
meanings.sent2: He bothers to clean his room before his parents visit.
meanings.sent3: I bother to water my plants every morning to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent4: The chef bothers to garnish each dish beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The teacher bothers to prepare engaging lessons for her students.
